featured.text: These sprouts grow slowly, nourished by the root system of the “mother” tree.
Slowly, however, forks came to be adopted by the wealthy as a symbol of their social status.
Slowly, the door opened and the old man appeared.
They nevertheless caution that a cutback may be necessary, such as running shorter distances or going more slowly.
As the applause __________, the curtain on the stage dropped slowly.

other.text: Rivers and streams flow slowly through jungles of shaded greens.
Some regions prepare horses made of cucumbers and cows made of eggplants, hoping that the spirits will come back to Earth quickly, on a horse, and leave slowly, riding the cow.
By the early 19th century, four-tined forks had also been developed in Germany and England and slowly began to spread to America.
Slowly, her behavior toward the other fish also changes.

definition.en_def: At a low speed; not quickly.
definition.example: She walked slowly to enjoy the scenery.
